unnormalised: ## Flash Sale Fever: Scoring Deals Faster Than You Can Say "Diwali Dhamaka!"
normalised: ## Flash Sale Fever: Scoring Deals Faster Than You Can Say "Diwali Dhamaka!"

unnormalised: Hey friends! Ever feel that adrenaline rush when you stumble upon an amazing deal that's about to disappear quicker than gulab jamun at a wedding? That's the magic of flash sales, folks! They're like surprise attacks on your wallet, but in a good way (mostly!).
normalised: Hey friends! Ever feel that adrenaline rush when you stumble upon an amazing deal that's about to disappear quicker than gulab jamun at a wedding? That's the magic of flash sales, folks! They're like surprise attacks on your wallet, but in a good way (mostly!).

unnormalised: Think of it as a retail version of "Kaun Banega Crorepati," but instead of answering questions, you're clicking "add to cart" faster than Amitabh Bachchan can say "lock kiya jaye."
normalised: Think of it as a retail version of "Kaun Banega Crorepati," but instead of answering questions, you're clicking "add to cart" faster than Amitabh Bachchan can say "lock kiya jaye."

unnormalised: Flash sales are short-duration sales, often offering significant discounts on a limited number of products. They’re a popular tactic in retail & e-commerce to create urgency and drive sales, especially around festive seasons like Diwali or Dussehra. I remember last year, my friend Priya almost missed out on a gorgeous silk saree from a flash sale on Myntra. She was on a video call with her family in Kolkata and barely managed to grab it!

unnormalised: But here's the deal: you gotta be quick! These sales rarely last longer than a few hours, sometimes just a single hour! So, keep your eyes peeled, subscribe to newsletters from your favourite brands like Fabindia or Ajio, and follow them on social media. They often announce flash sales there first.

unnormalised: Think about it: you could score a brand new smartphone at a 40% discount, a designer kurta for almost half the price, or even that dream piece of furniture for your new 800 sq ft flat in Mumbai!

unnormalised: However, remember to be smart, like Dr. Sharma always says, impulse buying can lead to regrets! Set a budget beforehand and only buy what you truly need (or really, really want!). Don't fall for the pressure to buy something just because it’s on sale.
